subject: Move common functions to FruUtils.cpp file.
commitMessage:
Move common functions to FruUtils.cpp file.

Move the common functions addFruObjectToDbus, updateFRUProperty
and isMuxBus from FruDevice.cpp to FruUtils.cpp for handling fru
daemon and ipmb-fru deamon avoid code duplication in entity-manager.

To avoid CI Issue in test_fru_utils, moved main function to
FRUDeviceMain.cpp file.

TESTED : Built Facebook YosemiteV2 images and loaded
on the target hardware. Verified all the fru's read and write.

Signed-off-by: Kumar Thangavel <thangavel.k@hcl.com>
Change-Id: Ic0cbebd00f896117d59c86b97fe6b6f217b7ba95

Patch Set 43:

(3 comments)

Have you done an analysis on what functions would be common between the (current) FruDevice and ipmb-fru? I expect the physical layer would be the difference. Some of the changes in this patch seems a bit surprising. Do you have a design doc to outline commonality and differences between the two services? That will be helpful for reviewing these changes. 

I did not read through all the comments for the past 30 patches. Sorry if it was already discussed.

Yes. Physical layer is difference in Fru-Device and ipmb-fru device. But the common functionalities between these two services are FRU format, handling, display the details in dbus. So, we need to move the common functions to FruUtils.cpp to reuse the existing code in ipmb-fru and avoid code duplication.

The functions related to FRU are "decodeFRUData", "formatFRU", "validateHeader" and getFRUInfo etc.

These functions already moved to FruUtils.cpp.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39592.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/50921

Other major common functions are "addFruObjectToDbus", "updateFRUProperty" needs to be moved to FruUtils.cpp for code reusability in ipmb-fru and avoid code duplication. 
In this patch, moved these two functions to FruUtils.cpp. To avoid CI issue in test_fru_utils, moved main function to FruDeviceMain.cpp file.

We don't have the design doc. Already discussed about ipmb-fru implementation and code move in the mailing list earlier. We have followed the ipmb spec for this implementation.

Thanks for the info. Are FruDeviceMain and FruDevice only be used by Fru-Device daemon while FruUtils are going to be shared by both Fru-device daemon and fru-ipmb daemon? FruUtils should not depend on FruDevice. There are changes imply that this is not true, which I commented also at the change line.

Yes. FruDeviceMain and FruDevice only be used by Fru-Device daemon. 

FruUtils is only going to be shared by both Fru-device daemon and fru-ipmb daemon.

Right now, FruUtils is depends on FruDevice since some of the functions of FruDevice are calling from FruUtils.  

Otherwise, lot of functions from FruDevice needs to be moved to FruUtils.
Please suggest on this.

> Right now, FruUtils is depends on FruDevice since some of the functions of FruDevice are calling from FruUtils.


I think these functions need to be refactored so the common functions do not depend on more specific functions in FruDevice or fru-ipmb
Ack. Working on Refactoring the code.
Add FruDeviceMain is not mentioned in the commit message. Is it meant to be part of this change?

FruDeviceMain.cpp is also part of this change. While moving these functions to FruUtils.cpp, some CI issue occurs in test_fru_utils because of FruDevice.cpp file added with main function to test_fru_utils.  So, I seperated main function with new file "FruDeviceMain.cpp" as refactoring. There is no logic change. Just refactoring with moving main function to "FruDeviceMain.cpp" file. I will update the commit message.
Move
Done
daemon
Done
I don't see these functions get moved

Ack. These functions were not moved to FruUtils. These functions called from FruDeviceMain.cpp file. So, Added function prototype declarations in this header file. 

Now, Removed the function prototype declarations in header file and added function prototype declarations in FruDeviceMain.cpp file itself.

I don't see new test cases, so this new dependency does not make sense to me.
Is it because FruUtils.cpp now depend on FruDevice.cpp? So maybe more things need to be moved to FruUtils?

Yes. FruUtils is depends on FruDevice. Especially in test_fru_utils.

Some of the test cases in test_fru_utils calling the function of FruDevice from FruUtils.

Lot of things needs to moved to FruUtils to make not dependent with FruDevice. 

But these things are not used by ipmb-fru daemon. I think, no need to move to FruUitls since it is common to both fru and ipmb-fru daemons.

Could you please suggest on this.
Probably need to refactor the functions to remove the dependency.
Ack

In this patch, Two major functions addFruObjectToDbus and updateFRUProperty are moved from fru_device.cpp to fru_utils.cpp. These two functions calling other functions like rescanBusses, writeFRU, hasEepromFile, getEepromPath, readBaseboardFRU , isMuxBus of fru_device.cpp from fru_util.cpp.  

So, that's why fru_utils is depends on fru_device.

Even if we split and refactor of these two functions, That is anyway depends on fru_device.

Possible Solutions :
1. If we don't want any dependency with fru_device, we have to move these functions rescanBusses, writeFRU, hasEepromFile, getEepromPath, readBaseboardFRU, isMuxBus to fru_utils.cpp. So we can avoid these dependency. 

But, Some of I2C and fru_device specific functions like isMuxBus, rescanBusses, writeFRU, hasEepromFile, getEepromPath, readBaseboardFRU has to be moved to common fru_utils.cpp.  

2. In another review comment, not suggested to move these I2C and fru_device specific functions to move common file fru_utils library. 

As per my understanding, we can follow either one approach only. 
If we dont' want dependency of fru_device, we have to move those functions to fru_utils.

If we don't want to move these I2C and fru_device specific functions to fru_utils, fru_utils will depends on fru_device.

So, Could you please suggest the best approach for this.

Looks like this can be 
1. Moved to FruDeviceMain.cpp and remain static, since it is only called there.
or
2. move to FruUtil since it is a generic utility kind of function

This busStrToInt is not used by both fru and ipmb-fru daemons. So not moving to FruUtils.cpp. Also, This function is called by both files FruDeviceMain.cpp and FruDevice.cpp. That's the reason, I kept this file in FruDevice.cpp with non static.
ACK
Should these be in FruUtils also?

I think, not required. These functions "loadBlacklist", "busStrToInt", "writeFRU" are using by fru daemon only and not used by ipmb-fru daemon. Also, these functions are calling from FruDevice.cpp and FruDeviceMain.cpp only.
ACK

Hi ZhiKui,

  Could you please review this patch and provide your comments/suggestions if any.

Thanks
Kumar.
This seems like the wrong place to be putting these, considering they're very specific to one implementation of the FRU, and is going to force dependencies on the common library, as you've seen.
Ack

Physical layer is only difference in the ipmb-fru implementation.
In Fru implementation, the fru data is getting using I2C where as in ipmb-fru getting fru data using IPMB devices.

So, The common functionalities like FRU formatting, FRU Validation and displaying in dbus and all same for both implementations.

So, updateFRUProperty function is used by both fru and ipmb-fru implementations.
That's why kept in common file to avoid code duplication.
?  Not mentioned in your commit message, and it's not immediately clear why this is needed.
packagedir is needed by test_fru_utils. That is the reason added with test_boost_args. Without this packagdir, CI failed for test_fru_utils.I will update this in commit message.

These look like dependencies that you've added to fru utils, not test_fru_utils.

Also, we need to have a discussion about this.  Having a common library that has this many dependencies makes it far less useful.  I would not expect a generic reusable library to take a dependency on any of these.
Ack
Generally when you need to forward declare methods like this implies that they need to be in an appropriate header.
Done
This is I think the 3rd place that this method has been forward declared.  Please don't do that.
Done
Considering this is VERY specific to a fru that exists on i2c, I wouldn't really expect this to be in a common class.  I suspect we need to refactor things a bit.
Ack. Working on Refactoring the code.
Done. Moved this function to FruDevice.cpp
This relates i2c bus and address, need to factor it out for the common function
Ack

Done. Some lines of code and functions Specific to Fru_device is calling based on the IpmbIndex == -1.

IpmbIndex = -1 - Single host, which is I2C based Fru.
IpmbIdex 0 to 3 - Ipmb-Fru based, used for multi hosts machines.
Here too, BUS and ADDRESS are for i2c device only?
Ack
Done.
Could you please provide your comments if any.
Are we expecting a patchset 43 to resolve the last set of comments?
yes. Working on Refactoring the functions. Will submit a patchset in a day or two.
fru_device.hpp
Ack
Done
missing include here
Ack
Done
How does this work if it is ipmb FRU?

Both FRU and Ipmb FRU has common IPMI format. FRU has I2C bus number and address, Fru data has been fetched using this bus and address. 

Whereas, IPMB FRU has the hostid as 0, 1, 2, 3 etc..  This hostId is mapped with this bus parameter. Address part is not used here and it will be always 0. 

Ex: If we want to get first host FRU data, then need to pass the hostid as 0 for bus parameter and address parameter is passed always 0 for IPMB FRU.
feels like this can still use some clean up, separate the common part between ipmb and i2c eeprom fru instead of just add parameters for both and do if statement multiple times
Ack. Almost all the possible separations are done in other places. These are mostly mandatory lines in this func for both fru's. I will try to separate the common parts as helper functions.
Done. I have separated the common parts between ipmb and i2c eeprom fru.
why special case ipmbIndex 0?

If More than one dbus objects are present in the service which represents multi hosts, then can append with _0, _1, _2, _3, etc..

Ex :

root@yosemitev2:~# busctl tree xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice
└─/xyz
  └─/xyz/openbmc_project
    └─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb
      └─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice
        ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_0
        ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_1
        ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_2
        └─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_3.

That is the reason added _0.

This can be skipped when ipmbFlag is true, right?

This can be a helper function by itself
what is the bus and address for ipmb fru?

IPMB FRU has the hostid as 0, 1, 2, 3 etc..  

This hostId is mapped with this bus parameter as 0, 1, 2, 3. Address part is not used here and it will be always 0.
